org.jetel.metadata

Class DataRecordMetadata

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.metadata.DataRecordMetadata
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<DataFieldMetadata>, IGraphElement

    public class DataRecordMetadata
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<DataFieldMetadata>, IGraphElement
    A class that represents metadata describing a data record. For possible concurrency problem see structureChanged().
    See Also:
    DataFieldMetadata, DataRecord, DataField, Serialized Form

      boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
      Two metadata objects are equal if and only if both have same number of fields, record types (delimited/fixed) and field types (string, integer, ...).

      • getFieldPositionByLabel

        public int getFieldPositionByLabel(java.lang.String label)
        Returns the position of a field based on the field's label. If the label is not unique, returns the position of the first occurence. If no such label exists, try to find a field by its name instead.
        Parameters:
        label - the label of the requested field
        Returns:
        the position of the field within the data record or -1 if no such field exists

      • setKeyFieldNames

        public void setKeyFieldNames(java.util.List<java.lang.String> keyFieldNames)
        Sets field names specifying a primary key of the data record. The names can then be retrieved back by getKeyFieldNames(), or they can be resolved into field metadata by getKeyFields().
        Parameters:
        keyFieldNames - the array of field names to be used

      • getKeyFieldNames

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getKeyFieldNames()
        Returns a list of field names specifying a primary key of the data record. Note that it is not guaranteed that all field names point to an existing field. On the other hand it is checked in configCheck()
        Returns:
        a list of field names specifying a primary key of the data record

      • getKeyFields

        public java.util.List<DataFieldMetadata> getKeyFields()
        Returns a list of fields specifying a primary key of the data record Note that it may return shorter list than getKeyFieldNames, if some of field names do not point to an existing field. Matching of field names is checked in checkConfig.
        Returns:
        a list of fields specifying a primary key of the data record

      • getRecordKey

        public RecordKey getRecordKey()
        Creates and initializes a record key for the specified key field names.
        Returns:
        a new initialized record key or null no key field names are specified

      • getNumNullableFields

        public short getNumNullableFields()
        Returns:
        the number of nullable fields
        Since:
        18th January 2007

      • isNullable

        public boolean isNullable()
        Returns:
        true if a data record described by this metadata contains at least one field which may contain a NULL value, false otherwise
        Since:
        18th January 2007

      • setRecordProperties

        public void setRecordProperties(java.util.Properties properties)
        Sets the recordProperties attribute of the DataRecordMetadata object Record properties allows defining additional parameters for record. These parameters (key-value pairs) are NOT normally handled by CloverETL, but can be used in user's code or specialized Components.
        Parameters:
        properties - The new recordProperties value

      • getRecordProperties

        public TypedProperties getRecordProperties()
        Gets the recordProperties attribute of the DataRecordMetadata object.
        Returns:
        The recordProperties value

        Parameters:

        value - the value to be set

      • setNature

        public void setNature(DataRecordNature nature)
        Sets metadata nature which should correspond with graph job type, see checkConfig(ConfigurationStatus). Different implementations of DataRecord are used for various natures.
        Nature JobType.ETL_GRAPH is represented by DataRecord.
        Nature JobType.JOBFLOW is represented by Token.
        Parameters:
        nature - nature of this metadata

      • getNature

        public DataRecordNature getNature()
        Record nature is by default derived from graph job type if is available. Local specification of nature is used only if the parent graph is not available.
        Returns:
        nature associated with this metadata
        See Also:
        setNature(DataRecordNature)

      • setEofAsDelimiter

        Parameters:

      • normalize

        public void normalize()
        The main method for record and field names normalization. First add all the fields to the record and set their labels: setLabel(String). Then call normalize() to set the names to their normalized versions and clear the labels, if applicable.

      • setNames

        public void setNames(java.lang.String recordName,
            java.lang.String... fieldNames)
        Sets the original names for the record and its fields. The names are first normalized and made unique. The normalized names are set as the new names. Then if the normalized names are different from the original names, the original names are set as the new labels. Otherwise the labels are set to null.
        Parameters:
        recordName - new full name of the record
        fieldNames - new full names of the fields

      • setNames

        public static void setNames(DataRecordMetadata metadata,
            java.lang.String recordName,
            java.lang.String... fieldNames)
        Parameters:
        metadata -
        recordName -
        fieldNames -
        See Also:
        setNames(String, String...)

      • init

        public void init()
          throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        Initialization of the graph element. This initialization is done exactly once at the start of the existence of this graph element. All resources which are intended to remain allocated during the whole time of the graph existence (including time between each graph run), should be allocated in this method. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the IGraphElement.free() method.
        Specified by:
        init in interface IGraphElement
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - some of the required resource is not available or other precondition is not accomplish

      • preExecute

        public void preExecute()
                throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is also initialization method, which is invoked before each separate graph run. That is, it can be invoked multiple times. Use IGraphElement.firstRun() to determine whether given invocation is the first one. Contrary to the IGraphElement.init() procedure, this method should allocate only resources for this single graph run. All resources allocated in this method should be released in the IGraphElement.postExecute() method.
        Specified by:
        preExecute in interface IGraphElement
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - some of the required resource is not available or other precondition is not accomplish

      • postExecute

        public void postExecute()
                 throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is de-initialization method for a single graph run. All resources allocated in IGraphElement.preExecute() method should be released here. It is guaranteed that this method is invoked after graph finish at the latest. For some graph elements, for instance components, is this method called immediately after phase finish.
        Specified by:
        postExecute in interface IGraphElement
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This method is called in case the graph run finished with success - Result.FINISHED_OK. Graph elements should use this for tasks which should be done if and only if all graph processing was completely successful. Each exception thrown from this method causes a FATAL error - the graph and all affected systems are in unexpected state. This method will be called only once the postExecute() method was already finished. Only one of commit() and rollback() methods will be invoked. NOTE: in the future this method will be called in the end of so called check-point area, which is something like restart-ability point defined somewhere inside the graph. For now whole graph forms one restart-ability area.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface IGraphElement

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This method is called in case the graph run finished with error or was aborted - Result.ERROR, Result.ABORTED. Graph elements should use this for tasks which should be done if and only if some part of graph failed. Each exception thrown from this method causes a FATAL error - the graph and all affected systems are in unexpected state. This method will be called only once the postExecute() method was already finished. Only one of commit() and rollback() methods will be invoked. NOTE: in the future this method will be called in the end of so called check-point area, which is something like restart-ability point defined somewhere inside the graph. For now whole graph forms one restart-ability area.
        Specified by:
        rollback in interface IGraphElement

        @Deprecated
public void reset()
           throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Deprecated. 
        Specified by:
        reset in interface IGraphElement

        ComponentNotReadyException

      • free

        public void free()
        Description copied from interface: IGraphElement
        This is de-initialization method for this graph element. All resources allocated in IGraphElement.init() method should be released here. This method is invoked only once at the end of this graph element existence.
        Specified by:
        free in interface IGraphElement
